entry.title: User coordination of soft fork activation
entry.summary: Martin has shared a proposal on improving UASFs (User Activated Soft Forks) through the use of smart contracts. The proposal aims to incentivize users to enforce the soft fork with lower risk of support being too low, while also ensuring that a significant part of the economy agrees to it. The contract would signal the intent to miners and other users in a way that would be expensive for sybil attackers. Additionally, the proposal suggests a unique way to pay developers for the development of the soft fork code. The document is timestamped in transaction 05d5eabcf77964a1e5a704175ef2e54f1fe243ed7aad0a80ede47845173bd2e5 in block 0000000000000000002f4b63ee720958da187405bb807466177be8da2c6ad3b6. Interested parties can review the proposal at the GitHub link provided by Martin.
